alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Northwest Randolph; Southeast Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 4:02PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, Pocahontas and southeastern Webster Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 401 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Addison, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marlinton, Cass Scenic Railroad, Greenbank, Snowshoe, Mingo, Durbin, Hillsboro, Dunmore, Monterville, Arbovale, Cheat Bridge, Bartow, Cranberry Mountain Nature Center, Slaty Fork, Minnehaha Springs, Frost, Boyer, Edray, Buckeye and Valley Head. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
